Selected Product: First  Mortgage Residential Closed
Purpose: Clients are requesting mortgage to refinance existing RBC mortgage ( rate 9%) ,  RBC won't offer more funds.  They want to consolidate all remaining debts. Clients are married and live together in an owner-occupied property in Edmonton.

Employment/Income: Client B1 is a self-employed Yellow Cab taxi driver, and earns about $45000 annually, as seen through bank statements. He's worked this job for over 10 years. Additionally, he gains income through OAS at $8618 annually, CPP at $8804.41 annually, and about $1589 annually through the Alberta Senior Benefits program.

Client B2 is self employed owner of a Blinds Installation Company, and earns about $30,000 annually. She also earns income through OAS ($8,618.40 annually), CPP ($3,316.72 annually) and the Alberta Senior Benefits program (about $1589 annually).

Credit Score: B1 has a score of 563 and B2 has a score of 641. Their scores are bruised due to multiple tradelines and high utilization. However, they have a good history of repayment. By refinancing and consolidating debts, we are able to strengthen their credit scores.

At 71.58% LTV, GDS and TDS are in acceptable range.
All ratios in line.

Exit Strategy: To refinance on B side once credit score improves.

Please contact Stephanie or Don at stephanie@bluepearlmortgage.ca or don@bluepearlmortgage.ca, or call 604.372.2764 for any questions.
Thank you!

Selected Product: Excalibur - Three Year

Clients looking to consolidate debts and get cash out to start an investment portfolio.

Income: Both clients have been with their employers for many years, income calculated per  Maria's T4s and Celestino's LOE. Celestino is also an Uber driver in his spare time, bringing in an additional $1900/m in income (not being used in the app for now).

Purpose: Clients are looking to pay off loans and use remaining funds for home renovations to allow for rental tenants, increasing income. Clients are married and they live in an owner occupied home.

Employment/Income: Client B1 is a taxi cab driver for his own company, and earns about $29,000 annually. He's worked in this job for over 12 years, Additionally, he is also the owner-operator of a cleaning company, and earns about $21,000 annually. He has ran this company for over 2 years.

Client B2 is a labourer for a maintenance company, and earns about $38,000 annually. They've worked here for over a year.
